page.title: 16Public Transport
page.content: The cost for an adult on a bus to go from Hawk Green to Stockport on the 359 a distance of about 5 miles would be 58p. If a pensioner were to travel somewhere by bus it would only cost them 10p. It would also cost a child under 16 years 10p. There are 19 bus stops in our area, and the 394 stops at 15 of them. People can buy Clipper cards which enables the passenger to have ten rides for the price of 9 and also saves the driver of the bus from collecting the fare. Most of the buses are double decker buses,each one holds 75 people sitting and 20 people standing. A single decker bus holds 41 sitting and 22 standing.The alternative to the bus is the train. Trains run less frequently and it costs more to travel on them.They travel far faster than buses.
